<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Discriminated union of Pass ID types.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The PassConfig API prefers dealing with IDs because they are safer and more</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="comment">/// efficient. IDs decouple configuration from instantiation. This way, when a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="comment">/// pass is overriden, it isn&#39;t unnecessarily instantiated. It is also unsafe to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="comment">/// refer to a Pass pointer after adding it to a pass manager, which deletes</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="comment">/// redundant pass instances.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="comment">/// However, it is convient to directly instantiate target passes with</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="comment">/// non-default ctors. These often don&#39;t have a registered PassInfo. Rather than</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><Highlight kind="comment">/// force all target passes to implement the pass registry boilerplate, allow</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the PassConfig API to handle either type.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><Highlight kind="comment">/// AnalysisID is sadly char&#42;, so PointerIntPair won&#39;t work.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/identifyingpassptr"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/identifyingpassptr/#a790955cd308751a47af3047ad6a048f3">IdentifyingPassPtr</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Set the StartAfter, StartBefore and StopAfter passes to allow running only</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// a portion of the normal code-gen pass sequence.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If the StartAfter and StartBefore pass ID is zero, then compilation will</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// begin at the normal point; otherwise, clear the Started flag to indicate</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// that passes should not be added until the starting pass is seen.  If the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Stop pass ID is zero, then compilation will continue to the end.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This function expects that at least one of the StartAfter or the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// StartBefore pass IDs is null.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
